page.title: 18Home Life - a working farmer
page.content: My name is{Clive Stark,}I live in {Fritton}and I{own a small arable farm of 95 acres. I rise at 6.30am, get washed and dressed. I set the table for breakfast and read the mail. I start work at 7.30-45.{A typical day would be to start muck carting by transporting the manure from the cattle-shed with a tractor and trailer to a heap near the field and later by spreading it on the field. I stop for coffee at 10.00 between muck carting shifts. Have dinner at 12.15 and check weather on BBC television. Perhaps in the afternoon I go and inspect my crops taking my gun to shoot a few pigeons. At 4.00 I have another tea-break, then do two more loads of manure. Teatime is at 6.00, usually the end of my working day.
